text: Ok

hmmm... maybe try putting the access token in both fields and see if it will accept it - if that doesn't work I think you'll need to create an OAuth app instead of a private app so you can generate both tokens

<@U01QVR44MEY> yes. i have used engagement api and upload file to particular contact.
Successfuly imported. thank you for reply
I have another question is there limit for file manger. not file size limitations. like 1000 file
lol inbound so far away!

<@U06CB6MK1F1> you could use the webhooks to add a property value to all deleted items, then you could use your code base the same way it is now and search on that property instead of using the other work arounds you were planning.

This would allow you to have a very simple piece to remove SHOULD the functionality be added in the future, only needing to change your query for this and removing the webhook aspect.

I have two questions. We are not storing any contact info do we still need to subscribe to this webhook? I mean what can we do with it, there is no contact info stored at our end. Moreover, if my public app is installed by user clicking the oAuth link on my client app. How does marketplace install works?
excited to get the first public app out soon!
It seems to just be a recommendation
but it's a good question - if you're not storing contact data, why do you need the contacts scope?
so this got my eye since it is listed as minimum requirement for listing the app in marketplace. We do a lookup of contact info.
Any caching?
caching on our end?
none
This is naturally just triggered by having the contacts scope, so I assume you can just ignore it if you're not storing it.
I would mention it in the marketplace submission though
At the last step you have to provide instructions on how to test your app (when submitting)
okies will do, so how does the public app install works in the marketplace do I need a redirect url pointing to my app and subsequent oAuth link?

It's pretty loose it seems. Some people link it to their website, and ask users to select a plan first, others just link straight to a URL on their server which generates and redirects to the authorization url. I've see two approaches:

1. App gets authorized first, then redirected to a pricing page
2. User is sent to a pricing page and then sent to an authorization page after.
haha that’s exactly how i pictured in my head given the info I had.
thanks sir!
I think the best UX in my opinion is going straight to authorization url
ok then redirect to my app. however I am not sure if there isn’t a session.
If you've already built it the other way I'd just go with that! haha
say the marketplace has an install button, when clicked it goes to my app ( prompts login or the page to the oAuth link if already logged in) bam ! done.
Ok can you answer for public app, if the url to retrieve authed recording is done once for app id?

Hey there, I want to make sure I'm understanding your question correctly

I think you're asking - do I need to create a new endpoint for authenticated recording URLs to be sent to for each recording - or can I reuse that same endpoint for multiple recordings?

The answer is you should be able to re-use that same endpoint for multiple recordings.
sorry for being not clear. I meant is this a one time thing ?
like a one off thing for my public app.
My understand is that it should be a one off thing
Thanks!
Not sure there are any documented limits, <@U25PYL3Q8> have you hit any types of limits?

Hey everyone :wave:  happy new year :tada:

I'm currently trying to get metrics on our website (hosted in HubSpot) such as sessions, page views, etc. through the API. Is there currently any endpoint that would allow me to get website metrics?

Thanks!

Hello, is it possible to create a Deal with Line Items that have a quantity more than 1 through the api? I have existing products in the Product Library and am using the <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/api-client?activeTab=readme|HubSpot API Client>. I’m able to create Deals, associate Products to create line items, but unable to set a quantity on those Line Items. Thanks!

I’m not sure there is a limitation. If you want to get attachements — here is an example for a deal

use `/engagements/v1/engagements/associated/DEAL/${objectId}/paged`

parse response, get the “attachments” — should have attachment IDs

Then you can get the signed urls
`/files/v3/files/${attachment.id}/signed-url`

then if you have a file url, that is good to go, that is how you get the file url…  then you can do whatever you want with it.

scope needed files.ui_hidden.read

Signed url is only valid for a few hours. so if you need to put it somewhere or attach it somewhere that works
I’m sure you could also get those attachments from the engagements and associate them with a different contact/deal as well
I think he was more meaning like a number of files limit in the file manager
I know you said you have this successfully already, but there have been 1000 questions about this so I just wanted to put this in here so I could search for this and copy paste next time.
<@U01QVR44MEY> “I’m not sure there is a limitation”
lol and then I just went off on my tangent
That was literally the first thing I tried, just punch through. Unfortunately it didn't work. Is there documentation on OAuth app that you would recommend? Thanks again.
That worked perfect - thank you.  All working now which is awesome!
glad that workd!!
